item.title: 28 Days Challenge
item.description: As Singapore launched its nationwide 28-days circuit breaker initiative from Apr 7 to May 4 2020, most of the firms are now required to work from home. With that, I am going to try to keep to an at least 3 papers a week schedule – to stay relevant and not let my brain rust! I’ll summarize and tag the papers I read by categories, say Dataset, Transfer Learning, so on and so forth.

item.title: About
item.description: I am currently a research engineer in Machine Learning at DSO National Laboratories, Singapore. I am working on improving automated fact-checking and AutoML techniques. I visited the Natural Language Processing Group at CSAIL, MIT from Feb. 2019 to Jan. 2020 under Prof. Regina Barzilay. Previously, I have worked on projects that involved using correlated Gaussian Processes for heat modelling and online incremental clustering techniques for entity resolution. I received a B.

item.title: Projects
item.description: Be Calculative A simple calculator app to compare interests across three major banks in Singapore: DBS, OCBC and POSB
